web_page.title: Connect to Wi-Fi on your iPhone, iPad, or iPod touch
web_page.introduction: Learn how to connect your device to a Wi-Fi network, including open, secure, and hidden networks.
web_page.heading: Connect to Wi-Fi networks

steps.step: Tap Settings > Wi-Fi, and make sure Wi-Fi is turned on. Your device will search for available Wi-Fi networks.
Tap the name of the Wi-Fi network you'd like to join.
steps.note: After you've joined the network, you should see next to the network, and in the upper-left side of your display.

web_page.heading: Connect to secure Wi-Fi networks

steps.step: Tap Settings > Wi-Fi, and make sure Wi-Fi is turned on. Then, tap the name of the Wi-Fi network you'd like to join. Password-protected networks have "lock symbol" by their names.
When asked, enter the password and tap Join. If tapping Join has no effect, the password you entered is too short.
steps.image: Enter password for secure Wi-Fi networks
steps.note: If you don't know the password to the Wi-Fi network, contact your network administrator.
After you've joined the network, you should see "check mark symbol" next to the network, and "WI-Fi serivce symbol" in the upper-left side of your display.

web_page.heading: Connect to hidden Wi-Fi networks
web_page.note: Since hidden networks won't appear in your device's list of available networks, you'll need to know the exact name of the network you're trying to join.

steps.step: Tap Settings > Wi-Fi, and make sure Wi-Fi is turned on. Tap Other.
Enter the exact name of the network, then tap Security.
steps.image: Enter name of hidden Wi-Fi network
steps.step: Pick the security type. Not all hidden networks are secure. Check with the network administrator if necessary.
steps.image: Security selection for hidden Wi-Fi network
steps.step: At the top of the screen, tap Other Network to return to the previous screen.
Enter the network password in the Password field, then tap Join.
steps.image: Enter password to join hidden Wi-Fi network
steps.note: After you've joined the network, you should see "check mark" next to the network, and "Wi-Fi service symbol" in the upper-left side of your display.
